Question 155) The figure illustrates a mine field match, the game present in virtually every personal computer. Four squares on a 16 Ã— 16 tray were opened, and the numbers on their faces indicate how many of their 8 neighbors contain mines (to be avoided). The number 40 in the lower right corner is the total number of mines on the board, whose positions were chosen at random, evenly, before opening any square.
In his next play, the player must choose from the squares marked with the letters P, Q, R, S and T to open, and must choose the one with the least likely to contain a mine.
The player must open the marked square with the letter
A) P.
B) Q.
C) R.
D) S.
E) T.
